article.title: The Millimeter-Radio Emission of BL Lacertae During Two gamma-ray Outbursts

choices: The spectral energy distribution of BL Lac.
The light curve of BL Lac at different frequencies.
KVN total intensity maps of BL Lac at 22, 43, 86, and 129 GHz.
The evolution of the spectral index of BL Lac over time.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the general trend observed in the light curves of BL Lac\'s core at all four frequencies in Figure 2?
choices: The flux density increases steadily over time.
The flux density remains constant over time.
The flux density oscillates periodically.
The flux density shows an overall decay over time.
The correlation between radio and gamma-ray flux.
Exponential fits to the light curves of BL Lac\'s core.
The morphology of the VLBI jet of BL Lac.
The location of the synchrotron peak in BL Lac\'s SED.

multiple_choice_question.text: According to Figure 4, how does the decay timescale of BL Lac\'s core flux vary with observing frequency?
choices: The decay timescale increases with increasing frequency.
The decay timescale decreases with increasing frequency.
The decay timescale is independent of frequency.
The decay timescale shows a periodic oscillation with frequency.
The Doppler factor of a relativistic jet.
The synchrotron cooling time of relativistic electrons.
The power radiated by a gyrating electron.
The energy distribution of electrons in a relativistic jet.
